Key Arguments: Determining what constitutes 'misinformation' is subjective and challenging.
No entity, including the government, should have the authority to decide what is true or false.
Historical examples show that accepted truths can change over time through investigation and debate.
Free speech is essential for discovering the truth.
The proposed legislation resembles actions taken by totalitarian governments and threatens freedom.
Notable Quotes: No one has a monopoly on truth.
The idea that people sitting in an office somewhere in Canberra hold all the wisdom on what’s true and what is 'misinformation' is absurd – and deeply dangerous.
